SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.photos.controllers

Class UserHomePageController

java.lang.Object
com.photos.controllers.UserHomePageController
public class UserHomePageController extends Object
The UserHomePageController class controls the user's home page view. It handles interactions with the user interface components, such as buttons and tables, to display and manage the user's albums.
Author:
Ian Underwood, Jason John

    • UserHomePageController

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the user home page view, setting up the album table and populating it with the user's albums.

    • handleTableClick

      public void handleTableClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles double-click events on the album table to open the selected album. This method is invoked when the user double-clicks on an album in the user's home page table. It sets the selected album in the `AlbumController` and loads the album view, updating the stage with the selected album's content.
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent triggered by the double-click event.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the album view.

    • handleOpenAlbum

      public void handleOpenAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of opening the selected album when a right-click event is triggered. This method is invoked when the user right-clicks on an album in the user's home page table and selects the "Open Album" option. It sets the selected album in the `AlbumController` and loads the album view, updating the stage with the selected album's content.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Open Album" action.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the album view.

    • handleRenameAlbum

      public void handleRenameAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of renaming the selected album. This method is invoked when the user selects the "Rename Album" option. It retrieves the selected album, opens the rename album view, and allows the user to input a new name.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Rename Album" action.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the rename album view.

    • handleDeleteAlbum

      public void handleDeleteAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action of deleting the selected album. This method is invoked when the user selects the "Delete Album" option. It retrieves the selected album and removes it from both the UI table and the user's album list.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Delete Album" action.

    • handleUserHomePageOpenAlbum

      public void handleUserHomePageOpenAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of opening the selected album from the user's home page. This method is invoked when the user clicks the "Open Album" button. It retrieves the selected album from the table and opens the album view, displaying the album's content.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Open Album" button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the album view.

    • handleUserHomePageCreateAlbum

      public void handleUserHomePageCreateAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of creating a new album when the "Create Album" button is clicked. This method is invoked when the user clicks the "Create Album" button on the user's home page. It loads the create album view, allowing the user to input details for a new album, and opens a new stage to display the create album form.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Create Album" button click.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the create album view.

    • handleUserHomePageSearch

      public void handleUserHomePageSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of initiating a search when the "Search" button is clicked. This method is invoked when the user clicks the "Search" button on the user's home page. It loads the search view, allowing the user to input search criteria, and opens a new stage to display the search form.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Search" button click.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the search view.

    • handleUserHomePageDeleteAlbum

      public void handleUserHomePageDeleteAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the action of deleting the selected album from the user's home page. This method is invoked when the user clicks the "Delete Album" button. It retrieves the selected album from the table and removes it from both the UI table and the user's album list.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Delete Album" button click.

    • handleUserHomePageRenameAlbum

      public void handleUserHomePageRenameAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Handles the action of renaming the selected album from the user's home page. This method is invoked when the user clicks the "Rename Album" button. It retrieves the selected album, opens the rename album view, and allows the user to input a new name.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Rename Album" button click.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the rename album view.

    • handleUserHomePageLogout

      public void handleUserHomePageLogout(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of logging out from the user's home page. This method is invoked when the user clicks the "Logout" button. It loads the login view, closes the current stage, and saves the user list.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the "Logout" button click.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the login view.

    • getUserHomePageTable

      public javafx.scene.control.TableView<Album> getUserHomePageTable()
      Retrieves the TableView of albums displayed on the user's home page.
      Returns:
      The TableView containing the user's albums.
